property.name: type
property.description: The type of item. For a toggle button item the value must be "button-toggle".

property.name: size
property.description: The size of the item.

property.name: autoHideDisclosure
property.description: Whether or not to hide the disclosure when the toggle button is clicked. The default is "auto" which will close the disclosure if the disclosures autoHide property is set to true, but leave it open if it is false. A value of "always" will always hide the disclosure. A value of "never" will never hide the disclosure.

property.name: actions
property.description: Bindings of events to named actions. The property names are those of events that occur on the item. Values are "click", "down", "up", "downhold", "contextclick", "dblclick" and "swipe". The value of these properties is then name of the action to fire when the event occurs. If an action named "back" should fire then the user clicks the item, the JSON would be "{click: 'back'}".

property.name: settings
property.description: The settings for the toggle button.

property.name: theme
property.description: The theme to use for the toggle button.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of toggle button. The default is "two-state", "multi-state" can be used for a multiple state button.

property.name: keepPressed
property.description: Whether or not to keep a two-state button pressed when the value of it is true.

property.name: layout
property.description: The layout of the toggle button. Values are "text", "icon", "text icon", "icon text", "text/icon", "icon/text", "text-icon" and "icon-text".

property.name: style
property.description: The inline CSS to put on the toggle button.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the toggle button.

property.name: hoverClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the toggle button when the user hovers over it.

property.name: pressedClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the toggle button when the user presses it.

property.name: disabledClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the toggle button when it is disabled.

property.name: iconStyle
property.description: The inline CSS to put on the icon in the toggle button.

property.name: iconClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the icon in the toggle button.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to use in the toggle button. Can contain template syntax that references control bar data. If there is a value in the data named "customer", it can be accessed by putting "{customer}" into the HTML.

property.name: icon
property.description: The icon to use in the toggle button.

property.name: hoverIcon
property.description: The icon to use in the toggle button when the user hovers over it.

property.name: pressedIcon
property.description: The icon to use in the toggle button when the user presses it.

property.name: disabledIcon
property.description: The icon to use in the toggle button when it is disabled.

property.name: bind
property.description: Bindings for the item.

property.name: value
property.description: The path to the property in the data that the value for the toggle button is stored. When the toggle button is two-state, the value will be a boolean, for multi-state it will be a number index into the data array.

property.name: data
property.description: The path to the property in the data in which the button definitions for a multi-state button are stored. The property must be an array of objects with each object containing the settings to display in the button (html, icon, hoverIcon, etc.).

property.name: show
property.description: The show expression for the item.

property.name: disabled
property.description: The disabled expression for the item.
